body_html:
How about statically linking tensorflow/compiler/xla/service/cpu:runtime_matmul etc. with the .o generated from tfcompile? That seems a bit cleaner to me.

I'm also curious about how you're using tfcompile -- typically I've seen folks either use the XLA JIT with TF, or use tfcompile to build a small graph that gets linked into the binary that does not otherwise use TF directly.

body:
How about statically linking tensorflow/compiler/xla/service/cpu:runtime_matmul etc. with the .o generated from tfcompile?  That seems a bit cleaner to me.

I'm also curious about how you're using tfcompile -- typically I've seen folks either use the XLA JIT with TF, or use tfcompile to build a small graph that gets linked into the binary that does not otherwise use TF directly.
